required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fate of Nutrient-Derived Amino Acids, FONDAA
clinical_study.official_title: Fate of Nutrient-Derived Amino Acids: Influence of Habituated Levels of Daily Dietary Protein Intake on Protein Utilization

brief_summary.textblock: 12 elderly (65-70 years of age) male subjects will be included and complete a double blinded cross-over study. They will be habituated for 21 days to either low or high protein intake (below 0.8 g/kg or above 1.5 g/kg, respectively). Following a 45 day washout period they will switch to the alternate group. At the end of each habituation period, the investigators will measure the appearance of labelled amino acids from milk proteins.

primary_outcome.measure: Abundance of milk protein-bound amino acid labels in blood protein.
primary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: After intake of milk proteins at time 0 (zero) the quantity of intrinsic labels D5-phe from whey and 15N-phe from casein will be measured in liver-synthesized blood protein at 240 min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abundance of milk protein-bound amino acid labels in myofibrillar protein.
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: After intake of milk proteins at time 0 (zero) the quantity of intrinsic labels D5-phe from whey and 15N-phe from casein will be measured in myofibrillar protein at 240 min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Leg phenylalanine rate of disappearance and appearance, net balance.
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From arterial and femoral venous blood samples obtained at baseline, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 240 min phenylalanine tracer enrichments and concentrations as well as plasma flow will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: First pass splanchnic extraction of dietary protein-derived labeled phenylalanine.
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From hepatic venous blood samples obtained at baseline, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 240 min phenylalanine tracer enrichments and concentrations as well as plasma flow will be measured. Knowing the amount of ingested protein and labeled phenylalanine we can calculate the first pass splanchnic amino acid extraction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Whole body phenylalanine rate of disappearance and appearance, net balance.
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From blood samples obtained at baseline, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 240 min phenylalanine tracer enrichments will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: The myofibrillar protein fractional synthesis rate
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From muscle biopsies obtained at baseline, 60 and 240 min the abundance of phenylalanine tracer bound in the myofibrillar proteins will be measured and the fractional synthesis rate will be measured within the first from baseline to 60 min and 240 min as well as from 60-240 min postprandial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of expression of proteins involved in muscle protein turnover
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From baseline to 60 and 240 min after intake of the standardized meal after 21 days of habituation to either a high or a low dietary protein intake expression of signalling proteins related to protein turnover in the muscle will be measured by use of western blotting.

Related to the trials conducted after 21 days of habituation to either high or low protein in the diet: From blood samples obtained at baseline, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 240 min urea tracer enrichments and concentrations will be measured. With this, and flow measurements, we can determine the rate of urea production.

secondary_outcome.measure: Nitrogen and creatinine excreted in urine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 21 days post intervention, 240 min postprandial and 24 hours post the day 21 trial day
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the adaptation to the 21 day habituation period to either high or low protein in the diet as well as the response to the standardized trial meal: Nitrogen and creatinine content is measured in urine is collected for the last 24 h of the 21 day habituation period, as well as during the 240 min trial day and the remaining 20 hours of the trial day.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from pre-intervention to 21 days and 22 days (21 intervention days habituation and the standardized trial meal on day 21)
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the adaptation to the 21 day habituation period to either high or low protein in the diet as well as the response to the standardized trial meal: The microbiota compositions, will be measured in fecal samples collected before the 21 day habituation period, after the 21 day habituation periode, as well as after the 240 min trial day

secondary_outcome.measure: Adaptation of expression of proteins involved in muscle protein turnover
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 21 days of habituation to either a high or a low dietary protein intake.
secondary_outcome.description: Related to the adaptation to the 21 day habituation period to either high or low protein in the diet: Biopsies taken following the two 21 day habituation period will, by use of western blotting, be analysed for expression of signalling proteins involved in muscle protein turnover.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Meal serving at high dietary protein
arm_group.description: Test the handling of meal-served protein when habituated to high dietary protein at an amount above 1.5 g protein/kg/day

arm_group.arm_group_label: Meal serving at low dietary protein
arm_group.description: Test the handling of meal-served protein when habituated to high dietary protein at an amount below 0.8 g protein/kg/day

intervention.intervention_name: Meal serving at high dietary protein
intervention.description: Participants are habituated to a high level of dietary protein intake for 21 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: Meal serving at high dietary protein

intervention.intervention_name: Meal serving at low dietary protein
intervention.description: Participants are habituated to a low level of dietary protein intake for 21 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: Meal serving at low dietary protein

intervention.description: To investigate impact of habituated protein level
intervention.arm_group_label: Meal serving at high dietary protein
Meal serving at low dietary protein

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hyperlipidemia
- Hypertension
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males age 65-70
- Independently dwelling
- Without any major health issues (blood pressure, cholesterol and lipid profile will be measured and evaluated by a physician)
- Non-diabetic
- No organ disease
- No back pain
- Not regularly take any prescription drugs or dietary supplements, which can influence muscle protein synthesis
- Alcohol intake below 21 units pr. week
- No known arthrosclerosis
